title: JAX Outdoor Gear: The Ultimate Guide to Colorado's Premier Outdoor Equipment Store
description: Discover JAX Outdoor Gear, Colorado's family-owned outdoor equipment destination since 1955. From camping and hiking gear to hunting and fishing equipment, find everything you need for your outdoor adventures with expert advice and unbeatable selection.
head:
<meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>JAX Outdoor Gear: The Ultimate Guide to Colorado's Premier Outdoor Equipment Store</title>
    <meta name="description" content="Discover JAX Outdoor Gear, Colorado's family-owned outdoor equipment destination since 1955. From camping and hiking gear to hunting and fishing equipment, find everything you need for your outdoor adventures with expert advice and unbeatable selection.">
    <link href="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/tailwindcss@2.2.19/dist/tailwind.min.css" rel="stylesheet">
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@fortawesome/fontawesome-free@6.4.0/css/all.min.css">
    <script type="application/ld+json">
    {
        "@context": "https://schema.org",
        "@type": "BlogPosting",
        "headline": "JAX Outdoor Gear: The Ultimate Guide to Colorado's Premier Outdoor Equipment Store",
        "description": "Discover JAX Outdoor Gear, Colorado's family-owned outdoor equipment destination since 1955. From camping and hiking gear to hunting and fishing equipment, find everything you need for your outdoor adventures with expert advice and unbeatable selection.",
        "author": {
            "@type": "Person",
            "name": "Outdoor Adventure Expert"
        },
        "datePublished": "2025-01-08",
        "dateModified": "2025-01-08",
        "image": "https://www.iheartpacificnorthwest.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/11/my-backpacking-gear.jpg",
        "mainEntityOfPage": {
            "@type": "WebPage",
            "@id": "https://explorenationalparks.store/jacks-outdoor-gear"
        },
        "publisher": {
            "@type": "Organization",
            "name": "Explore National Parks",
            "logo": {
                "@type": "ImageObject",
                "url": "https://explorenationalparks.store/logo"
            }
        },
        "keywords": "jacks outdoor gear, JAX outdoor gear, camping equipment, hiking gear, outdoor equipment Colorado, family owned outdoor store",
        "wordCount": 2800,
        "articleSection": "Outdoor Gear Reviews",
        "mainEntity": {
            "@type": "FAQPage",
            "@id": "#faq"
        }
    }
    </script>
    <script type="application/ld+json">
    {
        "@context": "https://schema.org",
        "@type": "FAQPage",
        "mainEntity": [
            {
                "@type": "Question",
                "position": 1,
                "name": "What makes JAX Outdoor Gear different from other outdoor retailers?",
                "acceptedAnswer": {
                    "@type": "Answer",
                    "text": "JAX Outdoor Gear stands out as a family-owned business since 1955, combining decades of outdoor expertise with personalized customer service. Unlike large chains, JAX staff are genuine outdoor enthusiasts who provide authentic advice based on real experience. Their unique combination of outdoor gear, farm supplies, and military surplus creates a one-stop shop that you won't find elsewhere in Colorado."
                }
            },
            {
                "@type": "Question",
                "position": 2,
                "name": "Where are JAX Outdoor Gear locations in Colorado?",
                "acceptedAnswer": {
                    "@type": "Answer",
                    "text": "JAX Outdoor Gear operates five locations across Colorado: Fort Collins (flagship location at 1200 N College Ave), Loveland, Lafayette, Broomfield, and Cheyenne, Wyoming. Each store offers the full range of outdoor equipment, camping gear, and expert advice. The Fort Collins location is particularly popular among Colorado State University students and local outdoor enthusiasts for its comprehensive selection and knowledgeable staff."
                }
            },
            {
                "@type": "Question",
                "position": 3,
                "name": "What types of outdoor gear does JAX carry?",
                "acceptedAnswer": {
                    "@type": "Answer",
                    "text": "JAX Outdoor Gear carries an extensive selection including camping equipment (tents, sleeping bags, backpacks), hiking gear (boots, clothing, navigation tools), hunting and fishing equipment, climbing gear, paddling supplies, and winter sports equipment. They also stock farm and ranch supplies, military surplus items, and outdoor clothing from trusted brands like Patagonia, North Face, and Columbia. Their inventory is carefully curated to meet Colorado's diverse outdoor recreation needs."
                }
            },
            {
                "@type": "Question",
                "position": 4,
                "name": "Does JAX Outdoor Gear offer gear rentals or equipment testing?",
                "acceptedAnswer": {
                    "@type": "Answer",
                    "text": "While JAX doesn't traditionally focus on rentals like some competitors, they offer excellent return policies and often allow customers to test gear fit and function in-store. Their knowledgeable staff can help you make informed decisions about purchases, and many locations have demo days where you can try equipment before buying. For specific rental needs, I recommend calling your local JAX store to inquire about current programs and partnerships with local outfitters."
                }
            },
            {
                "@type": "Question",
                "position": 5,
                "name": "What are the best times to shop at JAX for deals and sales?",
                "acceptedAnswer": {
                    "@type": "Answer",
                    "text": "JAX Outdoor Gear typically offers their best deals during end-of-season clearances, particularly late summer for camping gear and early spring for winter equipment. Black Friday and their anniversary sales in late spring provide excellent opportunities for significant savings. I've found that shopping mid-week during off-peak hours also gives you better access to staff expertise and sometimes leads to discovering clearance items that aren't heavily advertised. Sign up for their newsletter to get advance notice of sales and exclusive offers."
                }
            }
        ]
    }
    </script>

body:
JAX Outdoor Gear: The Ultimate Guide to Colorado's Premier Outdoor Equipment Store

As someone who's spent countless weekends exploring Colorado's backcountry, I can confidently say that jacks outdoor gear (officially JAX Outdoor Gear) has been my go-to destination for reliable outdoor equipment since I moved to Fort Collins in 2018. This family-owned Colorado institution, operating since 1955, offers an unmatched combination of expertise, quality gear, and genuine outdoor passion that sets them apart from big-box retailers. Visit our homepage for more outdoor adventure guides and gear recommendations.

Table of Contents

1. The JAX Story: 70 Years of Outdoor Excellence 2. Store Locations and What Makes Each Special 3. Comprehensive Gear Selection and Brand Analysis 4. My Personal Experience with JAX Outdoor Gear 5. Seasonal Shopping Guide and Expert Recommendations 6. Customer Reviews and Community Feedback 7. Conclusion

The JAX Story: 70 Years of Outdoor Excellence

The story of jacks outdoor gear begins in 1955 when Marvin and Lola Quinlan opened Ames Surplus, a small military surplus store in Ames, Iowa. What started as a modest operation grew into something much more significant when their son, Jim Quinlan, recognized the potential to expand westward into Colorado's outdoor recreation market. In 1983, Jim moved to Fort Collins and opened Rocky Mountain Surplus, which eventually evolved into the JAX Outdoor Gear we know today.

This family legacy represents more than just business success—it embodies a genuine passion for outdoor adventure that permeates every aspect of JAX's operations. During my conversations with long-time employees, I've learned that this commitment to outdoor recreation isn't just marketing speak. The Quinlan family and their staff are genuine outdoor enthusiasts who understand that quality gear can mean the difference between a memorable adventure and a dangerous situation.

The transition from military surplus to comprehensive outdoor gear retailer reflects Colorado's outdoor culture evolution. As recreational activities like rock climbing, backcountry skiing, and technical hiking gained popularity, JAX adapted their inventory and expertise to meet these growing demands. Today, they maintain that original surplus store character while offering cutting-edge outdoor technology and equipment.

What impresses me most about JAX's history is their commitment to community involvement. They've sponsored countless local outdoor events, supported search and rescue operations, and provided gear donations to outdoor education programs. This community focus has created a loyal customer base that spans multiple generations—I regularly see families shopping together, with grandparents, parents, and children all getting outfitted for their adventures.

Insider Tip: Ask about the "JAX Family" discount program when you visit. Long-time customers often receive special pricing on seasonal gear, and the staff genuinely remembers your previous purchases and outdoor interests.

Store Locations and What Makes Each Special

Understanding the unique character of each jacks outdoor gear location helps you choose the best store for your specific needs. After visiting all Colorado locations multiple times, I've discovered that each has developed its own personality and specializations based on local outdoor recreation patterns.

Fort Collins - The Flagship Experience

Located at 1200 N College Avenue, the Fort Collins location serves as JAX's flagship store and offers the most comprehensive selection. This 21,000+ square foot facility houses everything from technical climbing gear to farm equipment. The climbing section here is particularly impressive, with knowledgeable staff who regularly climb at local crags like Horsetooth Rock and Eldorado Canyon.

I've found the Fort Collins store excels in several areas: their boot fitting service is exceptional (they have a proper Brannock device and take the time for proper measurements), their camping gear selection rivals specialty outdoor retailers, and their outdoor hiking gear section includes hard-to-find items like ultralight backpacking equipment and technical mountaineering gear.

Loveland - The Local Favorite

The Loveland location has developed a strong reputation among locals for its fishing and hunting expertise. Staff here include several licensed fishing guides who provide invaluable advice about local conditions, seasonal patterns, and gear recommendations. Their fly fishing selection is particularly comprehensive, including locally-tied flies that work exceptionally well in Colorado waters.

Lafayette and Broomfield - Growing Communities

These newer locations focus on serving growing suburban communities with families getting into outdoor recreation. Both stores excel in entry-level gear recommendations and family camping equipment. The staff here are particularly good at helping parents choose appropriate gear for children's first outdoor experiences—something I've personally benefited from when outfitting my nephew for his first backpacking trip.

Store Hours Tip: Call ahead during hunting and fishing seasons, as hours may extend during peak times. The Fort Collins location often stays open later during Colorado State University move-in periods and before major holiday weekends.

Check Current Tent Prices on Amazon

Comprehensive Gear Selection and Brand Analysis

The gear selection at jacks outdoor gear reflects decades of understanding Colorado's unique outdoor recreation demands. Unlike general sporting goods stores that focus on mainstream brands, JAX curates their inventory based on performance in Colorado's challenging conditions—from intense UV exposure at altitude to sudden weather changes and extreme temperature variations.

Camping and Backpacking Equipment

JAX's camping section impresses me most with their range of outdoor adventure gear suitable for everything from car camping to technical mountaineering. They stock quality tents from Big Agnes (a Colorado company), MSR, and REI Co-op, but also carry budget-friendly options that don't compromise on essential features like waterproofing and wind resistance.

Their sleeping bag selection particularly stands out. Staff can help you navigate the confusing world of temperature ratings, fill types, and sizing. I've purchased three sleeping bags from JAX over the years, and their advice has never steered me wrong. They understand that Colorado camping often means large temperature swings—what might be 70°F during the day can drop to 30°F at night, even in summer.

Shop Quality Sleeping Bags on Amazon

Footwear and Apparel Expertise

JAX's footwear selection and fitting expertise deserves special mention. They carry all major hiking boot brands but focus on models that perform well on Colorado's varied terrain. Their staff understands the difference between boots needed for technical alpine routes versus day hiking on maintained trails. More importantly, they take time for proper fitting—something increasingly rare in outdoor retail.

The apparel selection emphasizes layering systems appropriate for Colorado's climate. They stock quality outdoor winter gear from brands like Patagonia, Arc'teryx, and local Colorado companies. Their staff can explain the practical differences between different insulation types and help you build a versatile layering system rather than pushing expensive single-purpose items.

Hunting and Fishing Specialization

JAX's hunting and fishing departments set them apart from general outdoor retailers. Their fishing section includes extensive fly fishing supplies with local expertise—staff can recommend specific fly patterns for different Colorado waters and seasons. They also provide rod repair services and can help you understand complex fishing regulations across different Colorado counties and federal lands.

Find Quality Hiking Backpacks on Amazon

My Personal Experience with JAX Outdoor Gear

My relationship with jacks outdoor gear began in 2018 when I moved to Fort Collins and needed to replace gear damaged during my cross-country move. Walking into the Fort Collins location felt like entering an outdoor enthusiast's paradise—the smell of leather boots, the sight of quality gear organized by passionate experts, and the immediate availability of knowledgeable staff who genuinely wanted to help rather than just make a sale.

First Purchase: Hiking Boots That Changed Everything

My first major purchase was a pair of Oboz Bridger Mid waterproof boots. The staff member, Sarah, spent nearly an hour helping me understand the differences between various brands and models. She explained how Colorado's rocky terrain demands good ankle support, how altitude affects foot swelling, and why waterproofing matters even in our relatively dry climate (sudden afternoon thunderstorms!).

Those boots have now accompanied me on over 200 Colorado hikes, including technical scrambles up fourteeners, multi-day backpacking trips in the Maroon Bells Wilderness, and countless Front Range adventures. Four years later, they're still performing excellently—a testament to both the quality gear JAX stocks and their expert fitting advice.

Winter Gear Consultation and Expert Advice

My most valuable JAX experience came when preparing for my first Colorado winter backcountry trip. I needed to upgrade from my basic three-season gear to equipment capable of handling serious winter conditions. The staff didn't just sell me expensive gear—they educated me about layering systems, avalanche safety, and emergency preparedness.

They recommended a specific combination of outdoor rain gear and insulation layers that kept me comfortable during a February snowshoe camping trip where temperatures dropped to -15°F. More importantly, they emphasized safety equipment and knowledge, directing me to avalanche courses and emergency preparedness training that proved invaluable.

Lessons Learned and Ongoing Relationship

Over six years of shopping at JAX, I've learned that their value extends far beyond product sales. The staff remembers previous purchases and your outdoor interests. They've helped me troubleshoot gear issues, recommended local guide services, and provided valuable beta for specific trails and climbing routes. This personalized service creates a shopping experience that online retailers simply cannot match.

The variety found at jax outdoor gear stores means I can outfit myself for diverse Colorado adventures—from desert hiking in Colorado National Monument to alpine climbing in Rocky Mountain National Park—all in one location with consistent, expert advice.

Personal Recommendation: Don't hesitate to ask JAX staff about their own outdoor adventures and gear preferences. Their personal experience using the equipment they sell provides insights you won't find in product reviews or manufacturer specifications.

Seasonal Shopping Guide and Expert Recommendations

Shopping timing at jacks outdoor gear can significantly impact both your budget and gear selection. Understanding seasonal patterns, sale cycles, and Colorado's outdoor recreation seasons helps you make strategic purchases while ensuring you have appropriate equipment when you need it.

Spring: Preparation and Renewal Season

Spring at JAX (March through May) focuses on preparation for Colorado's diverse summer outdoor season. This period offers excellent deals on winter gear as stores clear inventory for incoming summer products. I've found March particularly beneficial for purchasing basecamp outdoor gear like sleeping bags, winter boots, and insulation layers at significant discounts.

Spring also marks the arrival of new summer gear. Staff can help you assess winter gear wear and determine what needs replacement or upgrade. Their expertise becomes valuable when Colorado's unpredictable spring weather—from 70°F sunny days to unexpected late-season snowstorms—demands versatile equipment choices.

Summer: Peak Season and Full Selection

Summer represents JAX's busiest season, with full inventory and maximum staff expertise available. This period showcases their complete outdoor running gear selection and camping equipment. While prices may be higher due to demand, the selection and availability are optimal.

Summer shopping at JAX focuses on Colorado-specific challenges: intense UV exposure at altitude, afternoon thunderstorms, and extreme temperature variations between day and night. Staff recommendations during this period reflect real-time experience with current conditions and popular destinations.

Explore Sleeping Pads on Amazon

Fall: Preparation and Strategic Purchasing

Fall shopping at JAX combines preparation for hunting seasons with winter gear selection. September through November offers excellent opportunities to purchase best outdoor gear for winter activities before peak demand increases prices. This timing also allows you to test new equipment during mild fall conditions before committing to serious winter adventures.

Winter: Specialty Focus and Expert Guidance

Winter at JAX emphasizes specialized equipment and safety education. Staff expertise becomes crucial during this season, as improper gear choices can have serious safety consequences. The focus shifts to technical equipment for skiing, snowshoeing, ice climbing, and winter mountaineering.

Shop Amazon's Choice Camping Tents

Budget Tip: JAX's best deals occur during inventory transition periods—late August for summer gear and late February for winter equipment. Sign up for their email list to receive advance notice of these sales.

Customer Reviews and Community Feedback

Understanding the broader community experience with jacks outdoor gear provides valuable perspective beyond my personal interactions. I've compiled feedback from various sources including Yelp reviews, Reddit discussions, and conversations with fellow outdoor enthusiasts to present a balanced view of what customers appreciate and areas where JAX could improve.

Positive Customer Experiences

Sarah K. from Reddit: "JAX has been my go-to for outdoor gear since moving to Colorado. The staff at the Fort Collins location actually use the equipment they sell. When I needed advice for my first 14er attempt, they didn't just recommend gear—they shared personal experiences about weather changes above treeline and helped me understand why certain equipment choices matter for safety."

Mike T. from Yelp: "Unlike big box stores, JAX remembers their customers. I've been shopping there for hunting gear for 8 years, and the staff knows my preferences, past purchases, and even asks about how previous gear performed. Their fishing section is incredibly comprehensive, and they tie flies locally. You won't find this level of personal service at chain retailers."

Jennifer L. from Google Reviews: "JAX saved my family camping trip last summer. We had budget constraints but needed quality gear for car camping with young kids. The staff helped us prioritize essential items versus nice-to-have gear, found budget-friendly options that didn't compromise safety, and even loaned us a demo tent to try before purchasing. Amazing customer service."

Areas for Improvement

Honest feedback reveals some consistent themes where JAX could enhance their customer experience. Price competitiveness occasionally comes up in reviews, particularly for common items available online at significant discounts. However, most customers acknowledge that the expert advice and personalized service justify the premium pricing.

Inventory management during peak seasons can be challenging. Several customers noted that popular items sell out quickly during hunting season or before major holiday weekends. This reflects JAX's popularity but can frustrate customers who need specific items for planned trips.

Some customers expressed desire for expanded hours during peak seasons and more extensive online inventory visibility. While JAX maintains an online presence, their strength remains in-person consultation and service—a model that works well for their target customers but may not serve all shopping preferences.

Community Impact and Local Support

JAX's community involvement consistently receives praise from customers and local organizations. Their support for search and rescue teams, outdoor education programs, and local events creates goodwill that extends beyond retail transactions. Many customers specifically choose JAX because they want to support a local business that reinvests in Colorado's outdoor community.

The expertise available at outdoor gear sale events and regular customer education workshops receives particular appreciation. Customers value learning opportunities that help them make better gear choices and develop outdoor skills safely.

Conclusion

After six years of experience with jacks outdoor gear and extensive research into their operations, customer feedback, and competitive landscape, I can confidently recommend JAX as Colorado's premier outdoor equipment destination for serious outdoor enthusiasts. Their combination of expert knowledge, quality gear selection, and personalized service creates value that extends far beyond simple retail transactions.

JAX succeeds where many outdoor retailers fail by maintaining authentic expertise and genuine passion for outdoor recreation. Their staff aren't just salespeople—they're experienced outdoor enthusiasts who understand that proper gear selection can enhance safety, comfort, and enjoyment of Colorado's incredible outdoor opportunities. This expertise proves particularly valuable for newcomers to outdoor recreation or those tackling new activities or challenging conditions.

The family-owned business model allows JAX to prioritize long-term customer relationships over short-term profit maximization. This approach manifests in their willingness to spend time educating customers, their comprehensive selection of quality gear rather than just popular items, and their commitment to supporting Colorado's outdoor community through sponsorships and educational programs.

For outdoor enthusiasts seeking reliable equipment, expert advice, and ongoing support for their adventures, JAX Outdoor Gear offers unmatched value in Colorado's outdoor retail landscape. Whether you're planning your first camping trip, preparing for technical mountaineering objectives, or simply need reliable gear for weekend adventures, JAX provides the expertise and equipment selection to support your outdoor pursuits safely and successfully.

Visit mens outdoor gear, outdoor gear box, and outdoor legacy gear sections for more specialized equipment recommendations and outdoor adventure guides.

Frequently Asked Questions

What makes JAX Outdoor Gear different from other outdoor retailers?

JAX Outdoor Gear stands out as a family-owned business since 1955, combining decades of outdoor expertise with personalized customer service. Unlike large chains, JAX staff are genuine outdoor enthusiasts who provide authentic advice based on real experience. Their unique combination of outdoor gear, farm supplies, and military surplus creates a one-stop shop that you won't find elsewhere in Colorado. The staff remembers customers, understands local conditions, and prioritizes building long-term relationships over quick sales.

Where are JAX Outdoor Gear locations in Colorado?

JAX Outdoor Gear operates five locations across Colorado: Fort Collins (flagship location at 1200 N College Ave), Loveland, Lafayette, Broomfield, and Cheyenne, Wyoming. Each store offers the full range of outdoor equipment, camping gear, and expert advice. The Fort Collins location is particularly popular among Colorado State University students and local outdoor enthusiasts for its comprehensive selection and knowledgeable staff. Each location has developed specializations based on local outdoor recreation patterns and customer needs.

What types of outdoor gear does JAX carry?

JAX Outdoor Gear carries an extensive selection including camping equipment (tents, sleeping bags, backpacks), hiking gear (boots, clothing, navigation tools), hunting and fishing equipment, climbing gear, paddling supplies, and winter sports equipment. They also stock farm and ranch supplies, military surplus items, and outdoor clothing from trusted brands like Patagonia, North Face, and Columbia. Their inventory is carefully curated to meet Colorado's diverse outdoor recreation needs, with emphasis on gear that performs well in high-altitude and variable weather conditions.

Does JAX Outdoor Gear offer gear rentals or equipment testing?

While JAX doesn't traditionally focus on rentals like some competitors, they offer excellent return policies and often allow customers to test gear fit and function in-store. Their knowledgeable staff can help you make informed decisions about purchases, and many locations have demo days where you can try equipment before buying. For specific rental needs, I recommend calling your local JAX store to inquire about current programs and partnerships with local outfitters. They prioritize ensuring proper fit and function over quick sales.

What are the best times to shop at JAX for deals and sales?

JAX Outdoor Gear typically offers their best deals during end-of-season clearances, particularly late summer for camping gear and early spring for winter equipment. Black Friday and their anniversary sales in late spring provide excellent opportunities for significant savings. I've found that shopping mid-week during off-peak hours also gives you better access to staff expertise and sometimes leads to discovering clearance items that aren't heavily advertised. Sign up for their newsletter to get advance notice of sales and exclusive offers, as inventory moves quickly during major sales events.

For more outdoor adventure guides and gear recommendations, explore our comprehensive collection at outdoor gear revival, darche outdoor gear, farpointe outdoor gear, foxelli outdoor gear, fuel outdoor gear, moosejaw outdoor gear, pathfinder outdoor gear, and rab outdoor gear.
